intro: Wolffiella hyalina, commonly known as the glassy moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant is characterized by its delicate, translucent leaves that give it its common name. It has a simple thalloid structure with a central stalk and lateral branches. Wolffiella hyalina is often found in temperate regions and is an important component of understory vegetation in humid habitats.
